comments:
Build ID: 20070625

Steps To Reproduce:
BIRT 2.2

1. Run a report 
2. Once the report is generated, click 'Export Report' button and choose format as 'PowerPoint'
3. New dialog box will appear to Open / Save / Cancel report.
4. Press the cancel button.

Canceling will throw following exception

Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Connection reset by peer: socket write error


More information:
Is there any workaround available to handle this scenario gracefully ?

This issue is due to tomcat behaviour. If the client(browser) closed the connection(click cancel during the download) before tomcat sent all the data to client, it will throw this exception. We can't catch this exception, and this exception didn't impact application work. The only one thing is to cause the tomcat log file larger. You can change some settings of tomcat to disable logging. Not BIRT issue.

I do not think its Tomcat issue but BIRT issue.

1. Try to export the report to Word format.
2. Press cancel button when it asks to save the report.
3. No massive error log output is generated, infact no output is generated at all.

So why is that canceling a word export file is OK while canceling a PPT file generates massive error log ? I think the same error handling which is done for the Word case needs to be done to all export formats.

Im reopening based on above findings.

It looks like the PPT emitter ignores (but also logs) the SocketException and just goes on rendering, which results in a lot of exception messages. It should stop rendering if the catched IOException is of type SocketException.
use print writer in the PPTWriter.

Fixed.

Use PrintWriter instead of output stream to output data. PrintWriter will consume the exceptions thrown output by output stream so they won't be output to logging files.
